definition: to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
to be successful in every endeavor
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to advance by leaps and bounds
lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
qualitative leap
imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
to be invincible/unrivalled

to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
brimming with confidence (idiom)
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
